title: Linguine with Sicilian Pesto
introduction: Linguine with Sicilian Pesto is a flavorful dish that showcases the traditional pesto of Trapani, a seaside town in western Sicily. Unlike the well-known basil and garlic pesto of Liguria, this version incorporates almonds and tomatoes, providing a rich and satisfying taste. Perfect for a refreshing and fulfilling meal, this dish doesn't even require cheese, letting the natural flavors shine through.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 pound fresh tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped
instructions: In a food processor or blender, combine the almonds, garlic, basil, and salt and pepper to taste. Chop the ingredients fine. Add the tomatoes and oil and process until smooth.

Bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot. Add 2 tablespoons of salt, then the pasta, gently pushing it down until the pasta is completely covered with water. Stir well. Cook over high heat, stirring frequently, until the pasta is al dente, tender yet still firm to the bite. Set aside some of the cooking water. Drain the pasta.
Pour the pasta into a large warm serving bowl. Add the sauce and toss well. Add a little of the reserved pasta water if the pasta seems dry. Serve immediately.
